citations.narrative:
According to records, ten (10) parakeets (Melopsittacus undulatus) have died between February and May of 2025 in the
walk-through aviary. The facility maintains a population of about 500 parakeets and the public can enter a walk through
section and feed the birds from a stick. According to death records, approximately 10 parakeets have died by being
accidentally stepped on, kicked or caught in the door of the aviary. Small birds such as parakeets that interact with the
public are at risk of injury. During public exhibition any animal must be handled and supervised so there is minimal risk of
harm to the animal to assure the safety and wellbeing of the animals. Correct by end of business July 25, 2025.

According to records, five (5) parakeets (Melopsittacus undulatus) were found dead inside their primary enclosure with
signs of trauma consistent with predation between February and May 2025. An additional parakeet was found deceased
and stuck in a toy within the enclosure. Primary enclosures that allow predators to access the animals can lead to
unnecessary trauma, injury, or death. Toys and extra enrichment within the enclosure must be carefully monitored to
prevent injury to the animals inside. Correct by ensuring all primary enclosures protect the birds from injury. Correct by
end of business July 25, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
According to records, ten (10) parakeets (Melopsittacus undulatus) have died between February and May of 2025 in the 
walk-through aviary. The facility maintains a population of about 500 parakeets and the public can enter a walk through 
section and feed the birds from a stick. According to death records, approximately 10 parakeets have died by being 
accidentally stepped on, kicked or caught in the door of the aviary. Small birds such as parakeets that interact with the 
public are at risk of injury. During public exhibition any animal must be handled and supervised so there is minimal risk of 
harm to the animal to assure the safety and wellbeing of the animals. Correct by end of business July 25, 2025. 
3.153(a)(1)(ii)  Critical
   
Primary enclosures. 
According to records, five (5) parakeets (Melopsittacus undulatus) were found dead inside their primary enclosure with 
signs of trauma consistent with predation between February and May 2025. An additional parakeet was found deceased 
and stuck in a toy within the enclosure. Primary enclosures that allow predators to access the animals can lead to 
unnecessary trauma, injury, or death. Toys and extra enrichment within the enclosure must be carefully monitored to 
prevent injury to the animals inside. Correct by ensuring all primary enclosures protect the birds from injury. Correct by 
end of business July 25, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
